means: 赠给，授予( bestow的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: It was a title bestowed upon him by the king.
sentence.Network_cn: 那是国王赐给他的头衔。

sentence.Network_en: He considered himself unworthy of the honour they had bestowed on him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他认为自己不配得到大家赋予他的荣誉。

sentence.Network_en: I feel unworthy of the precious gift you have bestowed on me.

PerfectNetExp.abs: the king bestowed a case of gold on him ., 国王赐给他一箱黄金.
I do not deserve all the praise that is bestowed on me ., 他人赐我的一切赞美 , 我不是都该受的.
an honour bestowed on her by the king ., 国王赐与她的荣誉.
一些司机不尊重乘客。3. bestowed 授予奖项该国的最高奖章被授予给了他由于他的英勇事迹。

list.abs: God is impartial , the people who has destiny in hand stands forever in the balance both ends , the people who is grasped by destiny knows that God bestows destiny on him only only .上帝是公平的，掌握命运的人永远站在天平的两端，被命运掌握的人仅仅只明白上帝赐给他命运！
You remember having plenty of time to bestow all your wisdom knowledge ., 你记得你有大量的时间去传授你所有的智慧和知识.
He has long bestowed honours in exchange for donations to his good causes ., 他长期以来一直用授予荣誉头衔来换取对他的慈善事业的捐赠.
The Passionate Giver You love bestow presents , and not just on official occasions ., 激情式送礼者你喜爱馈赠礼物 , 而且不只是在正式场合.

entry.def: To bestow something on someone means to give or present it to them.

example.ex: The Queen has bestowed a knighthood on him.
example.tran: 女王已经授予他爵士头衔。
